WRITING.TITLE: Telling small white lies in a relationship and wondering about their past.
WRITING.TEXT: I ask my boyfriend a question about his past and instead of telling the truth he tends to tell a small white lie. The truth, the real answer wouldn #8217;t even hurt me. I know he does this to stop my feelings getting hurt but it #8217;s the white lie that hurts/upsets me. Even though it #8217;s not a big lie the small ones build up even though they #8217;re not really bad lies. Why does he do this and is it a really bad thing? Should I be wondering/interested about his past (with other girls)?

You just have to explain to her how much she means to you but of that #8217;s how she feels there not much I think you could do to persuade her. Usually those relationships don #8217;t work out as you go from being close friends to dating and those feeling are different. Rn you might want to save it but maybe you want to date a girl you can get to know because you guys basically skip the getting to know stage.
Please comment!

I #8217;m 18 and he is 20, my first boyfriend lied a lot and cheated so I do have trust issues. I think I #8217;m interested in his past because I want to make sure I won #8217;t be hurt again. I do overreact and overthink but lying is the only thing that makes me do so:(
That is true. I know he tells these small lies so I don #8217;t get upset but the truth doesn #8217;t even bother me it #8217;s only the lie that does
I think this comment is very rude? I came here for advice not to be told I #8217;m a problem for getting upset when I #8217;m lied to?

I have trust issue from my last relationship but they #8217;re so much better and I #8217;ve worked a lot on them. All I asked was are these small white lies bad. You don #8217;t need to come on my post acting horrible?
Okay but what should I do about the lies then? Accept them?
Honestly this was really good advice. Thank you and sorry I was indeniel before. I #8217;m going to talk to him. Thank you
Thank you so much you #8217;ve really helped me and made me realise my own mistakes.

WRITING.TITLE: Boyfriend being friendly with my mean friend.
WRITING.TEXT: I have a friend who I introduced to my boyfriend on a game. We played together for awhile with lots of other people. Recently this girl and my other friend have been quite mean to me and left me out and made me really upset when I #8217;m going through a really hard time. We #8217;ve not played on this game for awhile but one of my boyfriends friends invited her to this game today. I didn #8217;t speak to her the whole time but my boyfriend would answer her questions and if she did well in a game he #8217;d comment on it knowing she makes me cry a lot. Should I be upset? I know it #8217;s silly and it #8217;s a bit deeper than this but I tried to sum it up.
You prefer females, this isn #8217;t wrong if you left her. You might not even be as happy if u was dating a guy.

WRITING.TITLE: My boyfriend said he blocked this girl he used to be FWB with and I found out yesterday night he didn #8217;t actually block her
WRITING.TEXT: He used to be fwb with this girl but I always had suspicions they were more than that. It just made me feel uncomfortable so I asked him to block her on his phone and he did (after hesitation for awhile), he then got a new phone and she messaged him and he replied to her messages but then said he was going to block her after he replied. I found out she wasn #8217;t actually blocked and he #8217;d just deleted the messages between them. I know he #8217;d never cheat on me but can any one help me feel better about this situation?
It #8217;s not controlling, it made me uncomfortable and still does
I think I just always question, if the conversations they have aren #8217;t bad why does he delete every single one they have...idk I just don #8217;t know what to do really
Oh no i hardly ever go on his phone I never even remember his password #128514;Overreacting? He deleted the chats idek what they talk about
He told me to block my ex and I did without question or hesitation, I ask him to block her and there #8217;s always been some sort of problem around it so idk #129335; #8205; #9792; #65039;
He tells me he deleted them
He knows I think deleting things in a relationship is strange nd kind of suspicious so when she msgs him he lets me know and if he deleted them he #8217;ll let me know
No I #8217;m joking lmao
I just want her blocked #129335; #8205; #9792; #65039; he asked me to block my ex so why is it wrong for me to ask him to block someone

It was her number he blocked but thank u this made me feel better, I feel like some people on here just try so hard to tell people they #8217;re wrong for feeling how they do but this comment helped #10084; #65039;

Yes so he blocked her on his old phone then that one broke so he used he old one and she wasn #8217;t blocked and she texted him and I was like urm I don #8217;t really want u to reply :( but I #8217;m not stopping u from replying, so he replied and said he was gonna block her after that. But yesterday night I found out he didn #8217;t actually block her and he deleted their messages instead

WRITING.TITLE: Being called good girl during sex
WRITING.TEXT: I love to be called good girl during sex that #8217;s just what I #8217;m into. But when I hear my bf say good girl to like his niece it makes me feel strange/uncomfortable? Why is this?
I think maybe it is that, I #8217;ve said it before like u can #8217;t say it the same way but I say it jokingly I just don #8217;t know how to bring it up

But I can #8217;t tell him not to say it because everyone say oh good girl to a little girl if they do something well or if they do something you asked? Idk if to say just not to say it to me during sex but I like it a lot so idk what to do
He used to be like that and I #8217;ve been teaching him a lot of things but idk he said it just before and it make me feel strange to hear him say it in that way rather than a dirty / sex way?

Wdym a mental problem? I have no mental problem? It #8217;s just how guys when they hear their girlfriend call their dad daddy it can make them feel uncomfortable sometimes, it #8217;s the same thing ? Me liking being called a good girl has nothing to do with me mentally ?
I get what you mean I just think maybe what the other commenter suggested, working on tone of voice is better
Yeah like it feels weird hearing him say it in that way also, just hearing him say it in a none sexual way is just strange to me?
Tell your girlfriend for sure!
